articles.author: Chris DeMars
articles.description:
This is going to be the 2nd post in a small series we are doing on form accessibility. If you missed the first post, check out Accessible Forms with Pseudo Classes. In this post we are going to look …
Managing User Focus with :focus-visible originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Managing User Focus with :focus-visible

articles.author: Chris DeMars
articles.description:
Hey all you wonderful developers out there! In this post we are going to explore the use of :has() in your next web project. :has() is relatively newish but has gained popularity in the front end community by delivering control …
The Power of :has() in CSS originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: The Power of :has() in CSS

articles.author: Chris DeMars
articles.description:
Hey all you wonderful developers out there! In this post, I am going to take you through creating a simple contact form using semantic HTML and an awesome CSS pseudo class known as :focus-within. The :focus-within class allows for …
Accessible Forms with Pseudo Classes originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.

sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Matt Zeunert)
articles.description: The three Core Web Vitals metrics don’t only tell you how visitors experience your website but also impact your Google search result rankings. In this article, we’ll look at what Core Web Vitals are, how they are measured, and how you can use DebugBear to monitor them continuously.
articles.title: How To Monitor And Optimize Google Core Web Vitals

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Temani Afif)
articles.description: Creating 3D effects in CSS isn’t an entirely new concept, but typical approaches use additional elements in the markup and pseudo-elements in the styles to pull it off. Temani Afif applies 3D effects and sliding transitions to a single `` using clever CSS techniques that demonstrate advanced, modern styling practices.
articles.title: Sliding 3D Image Frames In CSS

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Mikołaj Dobrucki)
articles.description: Penpot helps designers and developers work better together by offering a free, open-source design tool based on open web standards. Today, let's explore Penpot’s latest feature, CSS Grid Layout. Penpot’s latest release is about efficiency and so much more. It gives designers superpowers and a better place at the table. Excited? Let’s take a look at it together.
articles.title: Penpot’s CSS Grid Layout: Designing With Superpowers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Victor Yocco)
articles.description: Victor Yocco reviews the components of the Transactional Model of communication, explaining how we might apply this framework to preparing, conducting, and analysing our UX research. You will understand how many UX research best practices align with the model and get an example of a tool for tracking alignment.
articles.title: Connecting With Users: Applying Principles Of Communication To UX Research

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Preethi Sam)
articles.description: What can we do to make a mobile app better? What subsidiary features are worth providing for our users? I have some ideas. You might, too. So, let’s compare our notes. Without any prescriptions attached, here are seven features I believe can palpably improve a user’s experience with a mobile app.
articles.title: The Things Users Would Appreciate In Mobile Apps

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Tatsiana Tarkan)
articles.description: Tatsiana Tarkan digs deep into iconography as part of a design system and shares some doable tips that will turn icon creation and maintenance into an enjoyable process.
articles.title: Iconography In Design Systems: Easy Troubleshooting And Maintenance

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Silvestar Bistrović)
articles.description: Remember the HTML `` element? It’s deprecated, so it’s not like you’re going to use it when you need some sort of horizontal auto-scrolling feature. That’s where CSS comes in because it has all the tools we need to pull it off. Silvestar Bistrović demonstrates a technique that makes it possible with a set of images and as little HTML as possible.
articles.title: Infinite-Scrolling Logos In Flat HTML And Pure CSS

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Could there be a better way to welcome the new month than with a little inspiration boost? We might have one for you: desktop wallpapers created by the community for the community. Enjoy!
articles.title: Colorful Blossoms And Rainy Days (April 2024 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Victor Ayomipo)
articles.description: There’s no shortage of articles about the mental health of developers, ranging from personal accounts of harrowing work experiences to round-ups of advice on how to preserve healthy work habits. But what working situations trigger things like stress, anxiety, burnout, and depression? Victor Ayomipo shares his personal triggers and how he manages them.
articles.title: How Developers Can Strengthen Their Mental Health Amidst High-Pressure Projects

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Based on responses from over 1,200 product professionals, Maze’s Future of User Research Report uncovers how product teams conduct research to inform decision-making and build successful products. Learn about the top three trends defining the user research industry in 2024 and beyond.
articles.title: The Future Of User Research: Expert Insights And Key Trends

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Henry Bley-Vroman)
articles.description: There are many ways to approach a “Dark Mode” feature that respects a user’s system color scheme preferences and allows for per-site customization. Henry Bley-Vroman walks through a new possibility that leans into cutting-edge CSS, with minimal JavaScript to support persisting the user’s color scheme preference across pages.
articles.title: Setting And Persisting Color Scheme Preferences With CSS And A “Touch” Of JavaScript

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Chiara Aliotta)
articles.description: Whether digital or physical, designing a customer touchpoint requires an understanding of the essential relationship between the brand and the user experience, which is also known as the **brand experience.** This article is a simple guide to building long-lasting customer relationships based on the seven rules of Rikyu in the Japanese tea ceremony for a creative and memorable twist.
articles.title: Crafting Experiences: Uniting Rikyu’s Wisdom With Brand Experience Principles

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: It’s here, and it’s shipping! Meet our newest Smashing book, ”Success at Scale”. It’s filled with practical insights and real-world case studies of how big changes can be made on projects of any size. Addy Osmani has curated finest examples, case studies and interviews to help you get successful at scale. Jump to the details and get the book right away.
articles.title: Now Shipping: Success At Scale, A New Smashing Book by Addy Osmani

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Krisztina Szerovay)
articles.description: How was the first SmashingConf in Antwerp, you ask? One of our online attendees, Krisztina Szerovay, shares her sketchnotes and takeaways of the talks that were held on both days of the conference — with photos and recordings saved as best for last. [See you live in Antwerp this year, maybe?](https://smashingconf.com/antwerp-2024)
articles.title: Sketchnotes And Key Takeaways From SmashingConf Antwerp 2023

articles.author: Dionysia Lemonaki
articles.description: When working with strings in C, you need to know how to find their length. Finding the length of a string in C is essential for many reasons. You may need to perform string manipulation, and many string manipulation functions require the length of th...
articles.title: Length of C String – How to Find the Size of a String in C

articles.author: Fanny Nyayic
articles.description: In this beginner-friendly guide, you'll learn how to create a responsive email template. You'll follow step-by-step instructions with code snippets to design an email template that looks great on any device.  This project is perfect for newcomers eager to master email design basics! Step 1: Set Up the Basic
articles.title: How to Create a Responsive HTML Email Template

articles.author: Kealan Parr
articles.description: I once had a manager who, in a discussion about our project, mentioned that we needed to try and shift our work left as much as we could.  A few months later in an interview, the interviewer asked me if I knew what " shift left" meant. Unless there's
articles.title: What Does "Shift Left" Mean in Software Development?

articles.author: Rajdeep Singh
articles.description: A GitHub wiki is a great place for your project's documentation. You can use the wiki to create, manage, and host documentation for your repository so others can use and contribute to your project. GitHub wikis are easy to start using without installing any other software. The best part is
articles.title: What is a GitHub Wiki and How Do You Use it?

articles.author: Kaushal Joshi
articles.description: In this article, we'll explore a simple trick that can save you hours of typing repetitive commands in the terminal. As developers, we spend a substantial amount of time executing commands on the terminal. Whether it's navigating through directories, running scripts, changing Node.js versions, or version control commands, manually typing
articles.title: How to Add Aliases to Terminal Commands in Linux and Mac

articles.author: San B
articles.description: As a software engineer, you may consider having a professional email account along with your own website, like "info@example.com". But this may cost a certain amount that you'll not be willing to pay. But do you know you can do it for free? There is actually a way to do
articles.title: How to Set Up a Custom Email with Cloudflare and Mailgun

articles.author: Tatev Aslanyan
articles.description: Karl Pearson was a British mathematician who once said "Statistics is the grammar of science". This holds true especially for Computer and Information Sciences, Physical Science, and Biological Science.  When you are getting started with your journey in Data Science, Data Analytics, Machine Learning, or AI (including Generative AI)
articles.title: Learn Statistics for Data Science, Machine Learning, and AI – Full Handbook

articles.author: Grant Riordan
articles.description: Let's go on a journey to demystify the concept of mocking in .NET software development. Let's delve into how straightforward and accessible mocking truly is. Join me as we navigate through this subject, as I cover:  * Understanding mocking: Why it's necessary for building a robust testing
articles.title: What is Mocking? Mocking in .NET Explained With Examples

articles.author: Vahe Aslanyan
articles.description: Building projects is one of the most effective ways to thoroughly learn a concept and develop essential skills.  Projects immerse you in real-world problem-solving, solidifying your knowledge and cultivating critical thinking, adaptability, and project management expertise. This guide will walk you through building a movie recommendation system that's tailored
articles.title: How to Build a Production-Grade Movie Recommender in Python – A Machine Learning Handbook

articles.author: Naomi Carrigan
articles.description: If you have donated to support freeCodeCamp's efforts, you can now claim a special Supporter role in our Discord community. Claim Your Role In any channel within our Discord server, type /supporter and you should see a command window pop up. Click C...
articles.title: How to Claim Your Supporter Role on Discord
